perturbation.original_text: Operator shall reimburse Owner for any Gas Payment Shortfall that Owner incurs within ten (10) days after Owner provides notice to Operator of such shortfall amount
perturbation.changed_text: Operator shall reimburse Owner for any Gas Payment Shortfall that Owner incurs within ninety (90) days after Owner provides notice to Operator of such shortfall amount
perturbation.explanation: Changing the reimbursement timeframe from 10 days to 90 days delays payment and potentially violates prompt payment laws, which often mandate quicker payment schedules, particularly in energy-related contracts. This delay creates a contradiction with standard business practices and legal expectations regarding timely payments for services rendered and costs incurred.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of state prompt payment laws.

perturbation.original_text: Operator shall determine (i) for each full calendar month (the “One-Month Power Performance Warranty Period”) within five (5) Business Days after the end of such month
perturbation.changed_text: Operator shall determine (i) for each full calendar month (the “One-Month Power Performance Warranty Period”) within thirty (30) Business Days after the end of such month
perturbation.explanation: Increasing the determination timeframe from 5 business days to 30 business days introduces a delay that could conflict with regulatory expectations for quick assessment of performance metrics. Some regulations require quicker reporting on power performance to ensure compliance and efficient operation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential conflict with energy regulatory reporting timelines.

perturbation.original_text: All notices and other communications hereunder shall be in writing and shall be deemed given when received if delivered personally or by facsimile transmission with completed transmission acknowledgment, or when delivered or when delivery is refused if mailed by overnight delivery via a nationally recognized courier or registered or certified first class mail (return receipt requested), postage prepaid, to the recipient Party at its below address (or at such other address or facsimile number for a Party as shall be specified by like notice
perturbation.changed_text: All notices and other communications hereunder shall be in writing and shall be deemed given only when personally delivered and acknowledged by the recipient. No other form of communication shall be considered valid notice under this agreement, regardless of proof of receipt.
perturbation.explanation: By restricting acceptable notice methods to only personal delivery with acknowledgment and disallowing other common methods like certified mail or overnight courier, this clause contradicts standard legal practices and could be deemed unreasonable. Courts generally recognize various forms of documented delivery as valid notice, and this clause's limitation may make it difficult to prove proper notification, potentially violating due process or fair notice requirements.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Conflict with general contract law principles regarding reasonable notification methods and potential due process concerns.
